title: Make progress bars visible with blue fill and show only when typing

requirements.summary: Update the username input progress bar to use the blue accent color (--accent) for the fill so the progress is visible
acceptanceCriteria: The username progress bar fill uses the blue accent color defined in the theme
The fill is visibly distinct from the background when progress increases

file_operations.description: Update the username progress bar styling to use the --accent CSS variable (blue) for the fill color instead of the current gray color. Locate the progress bar element (div with h-1 height) and change its background color from bg-gray-300 to use the accent color via style prop or Tailwind class that references --accent.

acceptanceCriteria: The room title progress bar fill uses the blue accent color defined in the theme

file_operations.description: Update the room title progress bar styling to use the --accent CSS variable (blue) for the fill color instead of the current gray color. requirements.summary: Show the username input progress bar indicator only when the user is actively typing in the username field (on focus/input activity)
acceptanceCriteria: Progress bar is hidden by default when the username input is not focused
Progress bar becomes visible when the user focuses or types in the username input
Progress bar hides again when the input loses focus

file_operations.description: Add state to track whether the username input is focused (e.g., useState for isUsernameFocused). Add onFocus and onBlur event handlers to the username input that set this state to true/false. Conditionally render the progress bar container based on this focus state, so it only appears when the input has focus.
